did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections and University Archives, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.unittitle: John Palmer Fishwick Papers, 1971-1981
did.abstract: The papers include speeches; testimonies for the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources, and other federal committees; minutes; memoranda; Legislation-status reports; and reports and other materials from the Organization of American Railroads created or collected by John Palmer Fishwick. Materials date from 1971-1981.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: The copyright status of this collection is unknown. Copyright restrictions may apply. Contact Special Collections and University Archives for assistance in determining the use of these materials. Reproduction or digitization of materials for personal or research use can be requested using our reproduction/digitization form: http://bit.ly/scuareproduction. Reproduction or digitization of materials for publication or exhibit use can be requested using our publication/exhibition form: http://bit.ly/scuapublication. Please contact Special Collections and University Archives (specref@vt.edu or 540-231-6308) if you need assistance with forms or to submit a completed form.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: [identification of item], [box], [folder], John Palmer Fishwick Papers, Ms1987-053, Special Collections and University Archives, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The John Palmer Fishwick Papers were donated to Special Collections and University Archives in 1987.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the John Palmer Fishwick Papers was completed in December 2014.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: John Palmer Fishwich was born in Roanoke, Virginia, in 1916. He graduated from Roanoke College and Harvard Law School. After several years in a private law firm and then in the military, he went to work for Norfolk and Western in 1945. Duriig his long career with the railroad company, he spent a ten year term as President and Chief Executive Officer of the Norfolk and Western Railway Company from 1970-1980. He retired in 1981, but not before aiding in talks that led to the merger and formation of the Norfolk Southern Corporation. He was also a member of the Board of Directors for the Virginia Foundation for the Humanities. Fishwick died in Roanoke in August 2010 at the age of 93.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The papers include speeches; testimonies for the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources, and other federal committees; committee/board minutes; memoranda; and reports created or collected by John Palmer Fishwick. Materials date from 1971-1981.

The majority of the collection consists of speeches and talks given by Fishwick between 1971 and 1981 at professional conferences, meetings, schools,graduations, dedications, and other events. The collection also contains testimony before the Senate, reports and minutes from board/committee meetings, newspaper articles and clippings, and professional memos.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
The collection is arranged into four series by material type:
Series I. Speeches and Talks
Series II. Statements and Testimony
Series III. Conferences and Board Meetings and Reports
Series IV. Memos, Articles, and Clippings Files within each series are in chronological order, with undated materials at the end.

odd.head: Rights Statement for Archival Description
odd.p: The guide to the John Palmer Fishwick Papers by Special Collections and University Archives, Virginia Tech, is licensed under a CC0 (https://creativecommons.org/share-your- work/public-domain/cc0/).
